title: Communications Services Up As Regulatory Fears Fade — Communications Services Roundup
text:
Communications services companies rose as regulatory fears faded somewhat.

Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said the social-media giant would soldier on with plans to help create a cryptocurrency-based payments network, despite requests from some lawmakers to halt the project until Congress had a chance to examine it further, as reported earlier.

Alphabet's Google has bowed to pressure from European Union antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager in offering better terms to rival search engines that want to appear on Android phones under a $4.8 billion antitrust decision, as reported earlier.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 23, 2019 17:02 ET (21:02 GMT)
